The revenue growth for UMC in 2021 was driven by several key factors. Firstly, there was a significant increase in the 22/28-nanometer technology segment, which rose from 14% of total revenue in the previous year to 20% in 2021. This increase contributed positively to the overall blended average selling price (ASP). Additionally, the computer and consumer segments each grew by 3 percentage points, reaching 17% and 27% of total revenue, respectively, compared to the previous year. The communication segment remained stable at 46% of the revenue pie.

Overall, UMC's revenue grew by 20.5% year-over-year in NT dollar terms and approximately 26-27% in US dollar terms due to the stronger NT dollar appreciation against the US dollar. This growth was in line with the company's previous guidance, reflecting strong performance and strategic expansion in key technology areas.
